required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A 15-years Retrospective Cohort Study in Children With Autism Spectrum Disorders on the Effectiveness of Dental Sealants and Fluoride Varnish to Prevent the Occurrence of New Caries
clinical_study.official_title: A 15-years Retrospective Cohort Study in Children With Autism Spectrum Disorders on the Effectiveness of Dental Sealants and Fluoride Varnish to Prevent the Occurrence of New Caries

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to evaluate if the application of pit and fissure sealants together with a fluoride varnish is more effective than the application of the only fluoride varnish in preventing caries lesions development in the occlusal surface of first permanent molars of children with ASDs. Demographic and clinical characteristics of patients at first dental visit are also investigated as potential protective and/or risk factors for caries development.

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of first permanent molars free from caries

secondary_outcome.measure: Survival rates of pit and fissure sealant
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of pit and fissure sealant sound

Evaluation if patient's variables at the first dental visit, such as age, number of dental caries, cooperation level, are positively or negatively associated with first permanent molars decay rates overtime.

arm_group.description: Application of 5% NaF varnish onto first permanent molars
Application of 5% NaF varnish plus pit and fissure sealant onto first permanent molars

intervention.intervention_name: Fluoride varnish and pit and fissure sealants onto first permanent molars
intervention.description: Quaterly application of fluoride varnish. Application of pit and fissure sealant, and replacements if necessary.

study_pop.textblock: Primary care clinic: participants were enrolled among those who have being received dental care at the Dental Service for ASD children of San Paolo Hospital, Milan, Italy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASDs
- age less than 14 years
- written declaration of informed consent signed by parents/guardians
Exclusion Criteria:
- incomplete clinical records
- missing five or more dental check-ups over the follow-up period
- oral or dental care provided in sedation or general anesthesia
- follow-up less than 15 years

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be available upon request
